meanings.definition: To pry open or force open with a crowbar.
meanings.sent1: He was crowbarring the old wooden crate to see what was inside.
meanings.sent2: The burglar was caught crowbarring the door of the house.
meanings.sent3: The detective joked that the suspect must have tried crowbarring the safe like in the movies.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like crowbarring through a wall of obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The image of him crowbarring the rusty lock stayed in her mind.

meanings.definition: To insert or incorporate forcefully or unnaturally.
meanings.sent1: She was crowbarring unnecessary details into her report.
meanings.sent2: The company was accused of crowbarring their products into the market.
meanings.sent3: The comedian crowbarred a hilarious joke into his routine.
meanings.sent4: His words felt like crowbarring a foreign language into the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The idea of crowbarring new rules into the game was met with resistance.
